message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SY 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating locally optimal kernel bandwidth for improving regression/classification performance, Bayesian optimization, and active learning. This falls under the domain of machine learning and optimization, which are covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. Specifically, cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are all relevant sub-categories for this paper. Among these, cs.LG is the most likely sub-category as it is the primary domain for machine learning research. The other sub-categories are also relevant as the paper deals with topics such as Gaussian processes, kernel methods, and control systems, which are covered by these sub-categories.
